column1: 25]  Further,  in  the  UK,  in  the  case  of  Dun  v  Information  Commissioner  and
National Audit Office (EA/2010/0060, 18 January 2011), the tribunal said that
there is no blanket cover of disclosure of personal data. It notes at paragraph
“The  Tribunal  does  not  accept  that  there  is  a  blanket  level  at  which  all
junior civil servants are shielded from disclosure of their personal data.
This has to be decided on a case-by-case basis, through consideration of
the role and responsibilities of the individual and the information itself.”
